Crowdfunding Campaign: Create a crowdfunding campaign on a popular platform like GoFundMe or Kickstarter to raise funds for the charity event. This will allow people to contribute to the event in small amounts and also help spread the word about the event.

Virtual Event: Organize a virtual event that can be accessed from anywhere in the world. This will allow people to participate in the event from the comfort of their own homes and also make it more accessible to people who may not be able to attend in person.
Sponsorship Program: Partner with local businesses and organizations to sponsor the event. This will help reduce costs and also provide an opportunity for businesses to give back to the community.

Social Media Challenge: Create a social media challenge that encourages people to participate in the event and share their experience on social media. This will help generate buzz and also increase participation in the event.

Volunteer Program: Create a volunteer program that allows people to contribute their time and skills to the event. This will help reduce costs and also provide an opportunity for people to give back to the community in a meaningful way.
